page.title: 13Community Projects in Weston
page.content:
Numerous groups and individuals in Weston are busy{charity fundraising or doing{voluntary work. }The WI do voluntary work and are sewing a quilt to auction for charity. The Ranger Guides recently donated money from a sponsored hike to research into cot deaths. The landlord of a local pub has just parachuted for charity. Many groups support the playing field fund.
The{Haywain Club,}formed as a charity fundraising group and named after the carts built here by the Boddington family (exhibit in Woodstock Museum), has 7 members who in the past year and a half have raised Â£500 for the play- ing field, given a kneeler to the church and Christmas presents to local children. The group also operates a {free car service}to take people to the Health Centre, get prescriptions, etc.
